history.content: To be honest, I don't think it is doable. The projects, when I took the class took me 20-60/80 hours depending the on the project. During summer, you only have roughly a week or two to finish each of the projects while learning the concepts at 2x the rate during a normal semester and also practicing/grinding exams. Your prior experience doesn't seem to be too strong, so I will assume that the projects will take you most of the time that the course gives you. If you do believe you're a strong programmer, I believe it is doable albeit very stressful. To do well in the class, just don't procrastinate! Good luck!

children.subject: Coming from someone who worked ~20 hrs/week while taking classes, try to be available for office hours whenever you can and be prepared to work at some odd hours. I'd say doable but stressful.
The “Sahai” recommended 20 hours is for a normal semester though. Summer is twice as fast, so that’s actually closer to 40 hours.
Good point! I forgot to consider that. I still think my point holds, if you’re happy working 60 hours / week, which I don’t think is unreasonable. (You’d have to work weekends though).

You should be fine! Many students (including myself) work 20 hour jobs during the regular school semester, with multiple classes and research. I think a 20 hour job + 61BL should be doable. Even if you spend the "Sahai-recommended" 20 hours/week on 61BL (which is a lot!), that's the equivalent of a full time job.

Took 61BL with a 20 hour TA position + CS 375 last summer. Wasn't easy, but was doable. It depends on the workload you're used to; if you're used to taking 4 techs/semester you'll be busy but not overrun, but I don't think I'd recommend it if you're used to <= 3 techs/semester

history.content: Hello. I am taking cs61bl this summer. I am also planning to work, expecting 20 hours a week. Is this doable? My prior coding experience is data 8 and cs88 this year. I usually have to spend a lot of time on labs and homework to understand the concepts. But I have been better at reaching out for help and find that tutoring is very helpful for me. I wanted to reach out to ask for advice on what things I should be aware of and tips to do well in the class. Particularly preparing for exams. Thank you.
history.subject: CS61BL + working over the summer
